intro: Leiboldia serrata, commonly known as the serrated leiboldia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to eastern North America, particularly the southeastern United States. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in a dense, spike-like inflorescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Leiboldia serrata is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
